measured_by: Interpersonal Reactivity Index – Empathic Concern subscale
justification: "Participants completed the 7-item empathic concern … subscales of the Interpersonal Reactivity Index (IRI)."

measured_by: Interpersonal Reactivity Index – Personal Distress subscale
justification: The method section states that the same 7-item Personal Distress subscale of the IRI was administered to participants.
"Participants completed a 25-item resilience scale … The scale, developed by Connor and Davidson (2003)…"

measured_by: Miller et al. 2014 Action and Outcome Aversion Scale – Action subscale
justification: "We assessed five items of action and outcome scale of Miller and colleagues (2014). Action aversion items represent aversion to performing prototypically harmful actions…"

measured_by: Miller et al. 2014 Action and Outcome Aversion Scale – Outcome subscale
justification: The same sentence notes that outcome aversion items "represent aversion to witnessing other's suffering one did not cause."
The paper explains that responses to 10 sacrificial moral dilemmas "allow for computation of … the tendency to reject harm regardless of outcomes (deontological parameter)."
The same battery yields "the tendency to … maximize outcomes regardless of causing harm (utilitarian parameter)."
An exploratory note says the PHQ-9 "assesses depressive symptoms."
The article adds that ProQOL-IV measures "the positive and negative impact of helping with three scales; compassion satisfaction, burnout and compassion fatigue."
Same sentence lists burnout as one of the three ProQOL sub-scales.
The ProQOL description also names "compassion fatigue" as a measured dimension.
